conclusion: Determine the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo.
Use the formula for the circumference of a circle, C = 2πR.
The inner diameter of the inner circle is 8R, therefore the radius of the inner circle is R.
The radius of the outer circle is 8R/3.
Calculate the circumference of the inner circle using C = 2πR, resulting in C_inner = 2πR.
Calculate the circumference of the outer circle using C = 2πR, resulting in C_outer = 2π(8R/3).
The circumference of the water polo is the sum of the circumferences of the inner and outer circles: C_water polo = 2πR + 2π(8R/3).
The speed of light in water polo is c.
Calculate the speed of light in water using v = C/sqrt(1 - v^2/c^2), resulting in v = c.
Calculate the propagation time of monochromatic light in water polo using t = d/v, resulting in t = (C_water polo)/c.
Simplify the expression for propagation time: t = (2πR + 16πR/3)/c.
Final simplified expression for propagation time: t = 22πR/3c.
